meanings.definition: Relating to the pleasant aspects of the countryside and country life.
meanings.sent1: The small town had a bucolic charm with its green fields and peaceful atmosphere.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the bucolic scenery of rolling hills and grazing cows.
meanings.sent3: The city girl's idea of a bucolic vacation involved a spa in the middle of a meadow.
meanings.sent4: The artist painted a bucolic scene that captured the essence of rural tranquility.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh hay in the barn added to the bucolic setting of the farm.
